description: Calibration factors comparing human (author) time estimates to LLM estimates. Computed as average of ln(human_hours) - ln(model_hours) across 3 tasks and 4 estimator models. A negative avg_log_diff means models overestimate time relative to the human baseline.

fields.avg_log_diff: Mean of ln(human_hours) - ln(model_hours). Unit: natural log (ln). To convert to log10, divide by ln(10) â‰ˆ 2.303.
fields.ratio: exp(avg_log_diff) = human_hours / model_hours. Dimensionless. Values < 1 mean models overestimate.
fields.model_overestimate_factor: 1 / ratio = model_hours / human_hours. Dimensionless. E.g. 3.25 means models estimate 3.25x more time than the human.
fields.n_comparisons: Number of (task, estimator_model) pairs contributing to the average.
